sub_title: Independent Maritime Consultant | Interim Project Management | Shipbuilding Development | Partner Maritimedevelopers.com
summary:
Remko Leinenga (BBA) studied Management Economics and Law after his study Naval Architecture (STC Rotterdam). Over 15 years of professional experience in strategic management, sales, procurement, project management, marine engineering and operations management within the yacht- and shipbuilding industry. 

His workmanship and experience are widely spread on the spectrum of ship building. The following key words provide the best description of Remko: enterprising, enthusiastic and results-oriented person. In his work are: courage to take responsibility, commercial thinking, customer focus and therefore providing an excellent service of great importance. Remko possesses good organizational ability and likes to take the initiative. Involvement, independence, good effective communication and mutual understanding are important values.

Remko worked with the mayor key-players in the shipbuilding industry such as, IHC, FEADSHIP, Royal Huisman, Damen, TB Shipyards, Western Marine, Peters Shipyard, VEKA, Ravestein, Boskalis, VOSTA LMG, Gelria, Vitters, Dutch Dredging, Holland Shipyards, Neptune Marine, Bijlsma Shipyard and DAMEN Yachting, 

Assessments/psychological test results:
Entrepreneur + social / creative + innovator / market developer.

Specialties:
✪ Maritime industry
✪ Shipbuilding
✪ Interim management
✪ Development and realization of maritime concepts/projects
✪ Hydrogen & Electric propulsion systems
✪ Projectmanagement 

Want to know what we can do for your organization or ship? Let’s have a drink!
 ☏ 06 – 21 39 88 47 
✉ RL@maritimedevelopers.com
www.maritimedevelopers.com

projects.title: TSHD ''ALBATROS'' (1500m3 ),  ''MAHURY'' (1800m3 ) and  ''LESSE'' (2300m3)
projects.description:
For Dutch Dredging/Baggerbedrijf de Boer. eL-Tec elektrotechnologie was responsible for delivering the electric system on board of three hopperdredgers. The installation was done by Dolphin Shipyard in Bulgarije after which eL-Tec was able to four fill the commissioning. 
- The first TSHD1500m3 ''ALBATROS'' was built at the Dolphin shipyard in Bulgaria and deliverd in 2013
- The second TSHD1800m3 ''MAHURY'' was built at the Dolphin shipyard in Bulgaria and deliverd in 2016
- The third TSHD2300m3 ''LESSE'' was built at the Dolphin shipyard in Bulgaria and deliverd in 2018

projects.title: TSHD Easydredge ''DASA1''(2700m3),  ''MAHAA JARRAAFU'' (3700m3) and ''CUBA1 (3700m3)
projects.description:
eL-Tec supplied the electrical installation for a series of "Easy Dredge" vessels for ROYAL IHC. The project was acquired after an intensive commercial effort and resulted in the package delivery of the electrical installation to a construction site abroad. eL-Tec took care of the supervision during and commisioning after installation.  
- The first TSHD2700m3 ''DASA1'' was built at the Dolphin shipyard in  Bulgaria, with destionantion Argentina. 
- The second TSHD3700m3 ''MAHAA JARRAAFU'' was built at the 3RMC yard in Qidong,  with destination  Maldives Transport and Contracting Company Plc(MTCC) 
- The third TSHD3700m3 ''CUBA1'' was built at the IHC shipyard in Kinderdijk, with destinationTecnoimport and Empresa Constructora de Obras Marítimas in Havana, Cuba

projects.title: TSHD4500m3, Shoalway, Strandway, Freeway, Causeway for Boskalis
projects.description: Causeway: second innovative trailing suction hopper dredger (THSD) in a series of four. Since the beginning of August 2013, a new titan has been navigating the seas and inland waterways. THSD Causeway is the successor to the earlier successful Shoalway. With her 90x19x7.25 metres, sustainable character and unprecedented electro-technical capacity, she is one of the most innovative ships from Boskalis. eL-Tec Electrical engineering in Hattem once again signed for the electrical engineering. Two years ago, Shoalway was such a success that Boskalis ordered three similar trailing suction hopper dredgers to be built. As a result, the Causeway is the second of these hopper dredgers in a series of four and because technology is developing further and further, her technical power is even more advanced than that of her predecessor. The Causeway is able to suck sand or soil, pump from ship-to-shore, rainbow and convey to hopper barges. The suction arm vacuums the bottom down to 28 meters below the waterline. She differentiates herself in her sustainability, performance and competitive price. eL-Tec took care of all the electro-technical installations of the ship, as they did before for the Shoalway. In the words of Remko Leinenga, account manager at eL-Tec electro-technology, ‘It was a terrific job to carry out. This ship is an outstanding piece of electro-technology. Owing to the high degree of automation, the work was very complex but with that, all the more challenging. Each system is translated into control actuation and we have specifically designed and developed these for this vessel. The data from the entire ship is monitored from the bridge.’ In total eL-Tec has been engaged in the construction of the Causeway for over a year. First, six months of preparation and then another six months of construction

projects.title: 6 vessels of the Sole 10.000 type
projects.description:
With a length of 116m, a width of 17.8m and a draught of 7.9m, it is the largest model that has ever rolled off the slipway at Peters Shipyards in Kampen, the Netherlands. 

The most striking feature of the Sole 10,000 is 70.5m long and 15m wide hold. This makes the ship a prime candidate for transporting high-value project cargoes of unusual dimensions. Furthermore, the Sole’s deck cranes can transfer cargoes at ports with a limited infrastructure.

Momentum Scan, built 2010
Marvel Scan, built 2011
Motion Scan, built 2011
Industrial Maya, built 2012
Industrial More, built 2013
Industrial Merchant, built 2013

profile_positions.description:
Our industry experts guide the development of your project, from first pen line to delivery and operation.

We enable Owners and shipyards to realise their dreams and goals on time, on budget and with full accountability.

We develop and manage your project.
profile_positions.title: Managing partner @ Maritime Developers; Enable project succes

profile_positions.description: Remko was contracted by Royal Huisman for Project Management of the world’s largest luxury sport fishing yacht in the world. At 52m, Royal Huisman’s Project 406 is set to be delivered in 2023.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
As Independent Maritime Project Developers we successfully deliver projects by being smarter, stronger and work with passion. 

Since technical staff is hard to get these days and the employment of highly educated staff has a more and more temporary character, we are focusing on being your reliable supplier of independent maritime management services. Working on your behalf we will be a true addition to the services you already offer.

Maritime Projects is a Dutch company that develops and manages projects for Ship Brokers, -Owners and -Builders. We can represent you or your client anywhere in the process. Our main activities are:

Surveys:  
We inspect vessels that are of particular interest to you or your clients,

Build supervision/Project Management: 
Contract management and supervision, Supervising the engineering, procurement and production processes. We monitor the processes in terms of compliance to clients wishes, quality, schedule and projected costs.

Project definition: 
Market research, preparing specifications, support of initial design, cost estimation, scheduling, tender requirements and yard (pre-)selection,

The reason for choosing Maritime Projects is that we work Smarter, Stronger and with Passion. Since all team members have their roots at a yard or supplier, we do have substantial practical knowledge, experience and a large network. Our team members have worked for yards like: Royal De Vries, Royal van Lent, Vitters, Royal IHC, Damen Shipyards, etc. All our people have acquired the highest grades in Maritime Education. More information about our activities and experience can be found on our website: www.maritimeprojects.com

We see ourselves as the lubrication between the principal and the builder. Our involvement leads to a smoother building process and delivery. The end result will reflect the owner’s wishes totally and will have the highest quality.

Together with you we will sail the extra mile!
profile_positions.title: Managing partner of the MPGroup (Maritime Projects, Maritime Professionals, Marimecs)

profile_positions.description: Maritime Projects was contracted by DAMEN Yachting for Project Management of explorer yacht ‘’GAME CHANGER’’. During a 10 month refit and warranty period, in which all of the yachts areas have been touched. We managed all related works with subcontractors and had the honor of representing Damen as first point of contact for the owners team on board.
profile_positions.title: Maritime Projects | Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Maritime Projects was contracted by De Keizer Marine Engineering to improve the internal build process and align their SEC (system engineering concept) with the shipyards needs. During the process more and more project management support was requested resulting in the role of project manager for build number 1008. 

Works involved;
- Active project management on build numbers 1008 (Moonrise)
- Align stakeholders
- Organize regular meetings and progress reports
- Reporting to head of projects and director
profile_positions.title: Maritime Projects | Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Maritime Projects was contracted by Royal de Vries Makkum (Part of Feadship) to support them with the growing demand  for a more clear and structured  plan of approach of their E-contractor. As both companies are family owned the job description was clear: make it work with respect to our long lasting cooperation. Look into the challenges we face, what works and what does not. Provide us with practical solutions for the current and future projects and make sure we are ready to face tomorrows challenges. 

Works involved;
- Active project support on build number 1008
- Inventory Cause and Context 
- Organize regular meetings and progress reports
- Job interviews with various departments and stakeholders
- Reporting to head of engineering and director
- Advice in visual and text
- Implementing of recommendations.
profile_positions.title: Maritime Projects | Intervention Manager

profile_positions.description:
For Lengers Yachts we have executed numerous surveys abroad for newbuilds and existing GRP/GRE motor yachts of 28-39 meters. In this role we act as owners representatives. 

Works involved: 
- Monitoring of planning deadlines, progress, and quality control
- Monitoring, overseeing and reporting on project development
- Supervision of commissioning (FATS, HATS, SATS), sea trials, and delivery of vessel to client
profile_positions.title: Maritime Projects | Owner's representative | Build supervison & Surveyer

profile_positions.description:
Maritime Projects was contracted by Royal IHC to support the shipbuilding cluster with streamlining of the electrical processes this department follows. 

Main task: Locate bottlenecks within the various departments /stakeholders and propose a recommendation for the reorganization within the shipbuilding division. This to ensure a project is built on specification, budget and in time. The major part of the assignment was physically executed in Kinderdijk.

Works involved;
-	Inventory Cause and Context 
-	Organise regular meetings and progress reports
-	Job interviews with various departments and stakeholders
-	Reporting to executive director
-	Advice in visual and text
-	Implementing and start up of recommendations.
profile_positions.title: Maritime Projects | Interim Management

profile_positions.description:
Main Interest is creating maximum achievement of commercial goals and customer expectations with an enthusiastic team of dedicated people.

As Manager for the maritime department I was Responsible for the (financial) project results, sales department, weekly planning, Contract terms, conditions and negotiations, regular consultation with our Vietnam office and part of the management team.

besides that, liaison for our existing clients and generating new business with customers in the maritime industry

Works involved; 
- Commercial:  Representing, Negotiating, 
- Operational: Forecasting, Controlling, Planning, Organizing,
- People: Staffing, Motivating/Coaching employees, Change agent
profile_positions.title: Manager Maritime Department

profile_positions.description:
Within this position I was responsible for the sales and marketing within the company. I'm widening the relation network for eL-Tec due to direct marketing by travelling and visiting ship owners, shipbrokers, exebitions and other companies related to the shipping industry. 

Our work: Build/design electrotechnical installations for the maritime business, coasters, yachts, inlandshipping, dredging, and also land based industry. We have a modern production facility in Hai Phong Vietnam.
profile_positions.title: Account Manager Maritime

profile_positions.title: Marketing Manager | Partner

volunteer_experiences.description: The committee consists of people from supporters of NMT who find it interesting to think about sustainability issues and who want to do their best to bring the whole industry to a (even) higher level of sustainability. During the meetings we discuss developments in this area and we will look what initiatives can be developed in the sector and from the association. Also, the committee is involved in internal and external sustainability policy of the association and she gives her views on matters that come to the sector by the government.

The association is primarily intended to promote solidarity within the company. She organizes trips and parties, brings a flower for prolonged sick and pays attention to anniversaries. As a Chairman and later treasurer I’m involved with the daily operations, initiating meeting and presenting financial results to all members.
